catalogue_raissonne: Meder 15 c (with scratches in sky and through small tree); Bartsch 15 (vol. 7, p. 38); Dodgson 62
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: four figures in Renaissance-era clothing lowering a dead body into a grave; two women at R, one looks outward, and the other one prays; another man stands to the far R; crown of thorns LLC, and opening to cave in background
portfolio: From From the Engraved Passion, Plate 13
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold February 9, 1983, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, lower right: [1512 / AD]
title: The Entombment, From the Engraved Passion, Plate 13
